items.headline: U.S. Stocks Rebound as Dow Closes Above 50,000 for First Time
items.summary: U.S. financial markets saw a significant rebound on Friday, February 6, with all major indices closing higher after a volatile week. The Dow Jones Industrial Average notably crossed the 50,000 threshold for the first time, fueled by a broad-based rally. Investor sentiment shifted towards optimism as equities recovered, particularly in technology shares, following earlier sell-offs.

items.headline: Nvidia Leads AI Rally
items.summary: AI chip leader Nvidia surged as risk appetite returned to the technology sector.

items.headline: Lumen Technologies Jumps
items.summary: Lumen Technologies saw a significant increase in Friday's trading.

items.headline: MicroStrategy Surges with Bitcoin
items.summary: Crypto-exposed MicroStrategy rallied as Bitcoin rebounded sharply above $70,000.

items.headline: Molina Healthcare Plunges Post-Earnings
items.summary: Molina Healthcare led Nasdaq decliners following its earnings report.

items.headline: Stellantis Drops on Business Reset
items.summary: Automaker Stellantis plummeted after announcing a significant business 'reset' that includes a roughly $26 billion charge.

items.headline: Amazon Slides on Earnings and Capex Plan
items.summary: Amazon.com shares slid after a disappointing earnings report and details of a hefty 2026 capital expenditure plan.

items.headline: Consumer Defensives and Industrials Lead Weekly Gains, Tech Rebounds
items.summary: For the week ending February 6, Consumer Defensive (+5.83%) and Industrials (+5.61%) were the top-performing sectors. In contrast, Consumer Cyclicals (-3.77%) and Communication Services (-3.7%) lagged. Technology shares, particularly AI-related hardware, saw a strong rebound on Friday after earlier volatility and concerns about overinvestment in data centers. Q4 earnings season shows 79% of S&P 500 companies beating expectations, with Tech leading earnings growth at 26% year-over-year.

items.headline: Fed Vice Chair Jefferson Comments on Economic Outlook Amid Mixed Labor Data
items.summary: On Friday, Federal Reserve Vice Chair Jefferson discussed the economic outlook, modestly revising up the 2026 growth forecast to 2.2%. He noted the unemployment rate at 4.4% in December 2025 and an easing pace of job creation, though other labor market measures point to stabilization. The market is now pricing in higher odds of Fed rate cuts, with a 25% chance of a 25-basis point reduction by the March 18th FOMC meeting. Upcoming key economic releases include the delayed US January jobs report and Consumer Price Index (CPI) next week.

items.headline: Mixed Bag for Major Earnings Reports; Amazon Disappoints
items.summary: Several major companies reported earnings, with notable movements. Amazon ($AMZN) slid after a disappointing report and a hefty 2026 capital expenditure plan. Molina Healthcare ($MOH) plunged post-earnings, while Roblox ($RBLX) surged almost 10%. Doximity ($DOCS) dropped 17% and Coty ($COTY) retreated 16% following their respective reports.
